title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.24 - Executive Order No. 24: Declaring a Disaster Emergency in the Counties of Albany, Allegany, Broome, Cattaraugus, Cayuga, Chemung, Chenango, Clinton, Columbia, Cortland, Delaware, Essex, Greene, Herkimer, Montgomery, Ontario, Orange, Otsego, Rensselaer, Saratoga, Schenectady, Shoharie, Schuyler, Steuben, Sullivan, Tioga, Ulster, Washington and Yates and Contiguous Areas. [*]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5.24 - Executive Order No. 24: Declaring a Disaster Emergency in the Counties of Albany, Allegany, Broome, Cattaraugus, Cayuga, Chemung, Chenango, Clinton, Columbia, Cortland, Delaware, Essex, Greene, Herkimer, Montgomery, Ontario, Orange, Otsego, Rensselaer, Saratoga, Schenectady, Shoharie, Schuyler, Steuben, Sullivan, Tioga, Ulster, Washington and Yates and Contiguous Areas. [*]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, beginning on January 19, 1996 a severe winter
storm accompanied by heavy rains and high winds has caused flooding, and has
resulted in personal hardship, damage to residential and commercial properties
and the agricultural community, as well as disruption of vital public
transportation and public safety systems and the destruction of flood
protection structures in Albany, Allegany, Broome, Cattaraugus, Cayuga, Chemung, Chenango, Clinton, Columbia, Cortland, Delaware, Essex, Greene, Herkimer, Montgomery, Ontario, Orange, Otsego, Rensselaer, Saratoga, Schenectady, Schoharie, Schuyler, Steuben, Sullivan, Tioga, Ulster, Washington
and Yates and contiguous areas; and
WHEREAS, this storm and flooding has resulted in at least
ten fatalities and continues to threaten the public health and safety and cause
damage to the public infrastructure; NOW, THEREFORE, I, GEORGE E. PATAKI, Governor of the State
of New York, do hereby find that a disaster has occurred for which the affected
local governments are unable to respond adequately. Therefore, pursuant to the
authority vested in me by the Constitution of the State of New York and section
28 of article 2-B of the Executive Law, I hereby declare a State Disaster

Emergency effective January 19, 1996, within the territorial boundaries of

Albany, Allegany, Broome, Cattaraugus, Cayuga, Chemung, Chenango, Clinton, Columbia, Cortland, Delaware, Essex, Greene, Herkimer, Montgomery, Ontario, Orange, Otsego, Rensselaer, Saratoga, Schenectady, Schoharie, Schuyler, Steuben, Sullivan, Tioga, Ulster, Washington and Yates and contiguous areas; and
FURTHER, pursuant to section 29 of article 2-B of the

Executive Law, I direct the implementation of the State Disaster Preparedness

Plan and authorize, effective January 19, 1996, the State Emergency Management

Office and other State agencies as necessary, to take appropriate action to
protect State property and to assist those affected local governments and
individuals in responding to and recovering from this disaster, and to provide
such other assistance as necessary to protect the public health and
safety. Signed: George E. Pataki

Dated: January 22, 1996

Notes

5.24

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
